name: Eamonn W. Postlethwaite
content: Eamonn Postlethwaite | King's College London Skip to main contentDr Eamonn Postlethwaite Lecturer in CryptographyResearch interestsComputer scienceContact detailseamonn.postlethwaite@kcl.ac.ukBiographyEamonn Postlethwaite is a Lecturer in the Cybersecurity group of the Department of Informatics at King's College London. Previously, he was a post doctoral researcher at Centrum Wiskunde & Informatica, Amsterdam and a PhD student at Royal Holloway, University of London. Research interests Constructions of cryptographic primitives from lattice based assumptions Cryptanalysis of lattice based cryptography Standardisation of post quantum cryptography Further information Research profile ResearchResearchCybersecurityThe group studies design, modelling, analysis, verification and testing of networks and systems.ResearchResearchCybersecurityThe group studies design, modelling, analysis, verification and testing of networks and systems.(N)6.03Bush HouseStrand campus, 30 Aldwych, London, WC2B 4BGBased inDepartment of InformaticsFaculty of Natural, Mathematical & Engineering Sciences
